results.title: Masterpieces from the Louvre: bronze sculptures from France
results.creator_credit: QAG, Nine Network (Australia), Caroline Turner, David Burnett and Bob Mclean
results.brief_description: In 1988, in conjunction with EXPO, a series of bronze sculptures and paintings, considered masterpieces of French art from the 16th-19th centuries, and which are housed at the Louvre, were exhibited at the Queensland Art Gallery. This video is a potted art history from the Renaissance to Rodin. It looks at famous patrons such as Louis XIV, the Sun King; well regarded artists and sculptors of the time; and gives a brief explanation of the key movements in Art History during that time.

results.title: Mastering Your Microwave
results.brief_description: Many new microwave owners experience great frustration when trying to learn the techniques and principles of microwave cooking. They often feel they will never master the art. The “Mastering Your Microwave” video cookbook collection has been produced by international microwave consultant, Joan McDermott, to help overcome these problems. Everyday recipes including roast meats, souffles, vegetables and fish are included on this video. Rated: G

results.title: Mastering change: video workbook [text]
results.brief_description: Change occurs in all the areas of our lives and cannot be avoided. This workbook, which accompanies the video set looks at skills which can be developed to successfully cope with and make the most of change.

results.title: Mastering change: managing your future in an age of uncertainty
results.creator_credit: CareerTrack Publications, Matthew A Keller and Stephen Sealy
results.brief_description: Designed to develop skills which will enable employees to cope with change and managers to introduce change with positive effects. Part 1 looks at understanding change. Part 2 presents keys to becoming change skilled, to become a victor rather than a victim of change. Part 3 gives six steps to responding to organisational change while Part 4 examines the development of future tense thinking. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.

results.title: Mastering change: management and leadership skills for turbulent times
results.creator_credit: CareerTrack Publications, Matthew A Keller and Stephen Sealy
results.brief_description: Designed to assist managers in the implementation of change and to ensure that employees deal with change effectively. Part 1 examines management and leadership issues and understanding the processes involved in organisational change. Part 2 looks at planning for change rather than allowing it to happen suddenly. Part 3 presents the “4 C’s” involved in managing the implementation of change. Part 4 highlights the issues involved in leading a team into the future. A handbook accompanies the series with exercises to reinforce relevant points.

results.title: Masterclass with Menuhin
results.brief_description: The Guelph Spring Festival provides the backdrop for this extraordinary meeting of two of the most impressive prodigies of the violin: 76 year old Yehudi Menuhin and 14 year old Corey Cerovsek. With the Camerata Lysy Gstaad, his own student orchestra from Switzerland, Menuhin - with characteristic warmth, humour and rigour - holds a master class for some of Canada’s violin students. The culmination is a dramatic performance of Bach’s “Double Violin Concerto” by Menuhin and Cerovsek. Rated: G

results.title: Master weavers of the Andes
results.brief_description: Examines the craft of weaving as practised by the Quechua Indians near Cuzco, Peru. Points out that except for the use of chemical dyes, the processes of spinning and weaving are practised as they have been for centuries. Camera and editing Peter Pilafian. Narrated by David Ossman.

results.title: Master of the house = Du skal aere din hustru: thou shalt honour thy wife
results.creator_credit: Palladium Films and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: Since the collapse of his business, Victor (Meyer) has grown increasingly morose, ill tempered, selfish and demanding. Unaware of the plight of his wife and three children to keep the family fed and clothed, Victor persists in treating his wife harshly, and her health deteriorates. To aid her recovery, Victor’s wife is sent away from the home duties that have burdened her for so long. In exchange, Victor’s old nanny moves in, and treating him as if he was the age when she initially cared for him, shows him the path towards self recognition and amends his cruel ways. Cast includes Johannes Meyer, Astrid Holm, Mathilde Nielson and Clara Schonfeld.

results.title: Massive Attack: eleven promos
results.brief_description: The pioneering force behind the rise of trip-hop, British band Massive Attack were among the most innovative and influential groups of their generation, renowned for their talents at combining the sounds of hip hop rhythms, soulful melodies, dub grooves and choice samples. Their music is hypnotic, cinematic (in fact their music has featured on numerous soundtracks) and frequently political, addressing the inequities of society and the perilous state of mankind. This disc features eleven film clips, ranging from 1990-98, and includes: Daydreaming (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1990) ; Unfinished sympathy (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1991) ; Safe from harm (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1991) ; Be thankful for what you’ve got (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1992) ; Sly (Dir: Stephane Sednaoui, 1994) ; Protection (Dir: Michel Gondry, 1995) ; Karmacoma (Dir: Jonathan Glazer, 1995) ; Risingson (Dir: Walter Stern, 1997) ; Teardrop (Dir: Billie Walsh, 1990) ; Angel (Dir: Walter Stern, 1998) ; Inertia Creeps (Dir: Wiz, 1998). The clips range in technique, some, like “Inertia Creeps”, are stylish and conceptual, others such as “Safe from harm” and “Unfinished sympathy” are notable for their location (a disused tower block, East London and Peico Avenue, Los Angeles respectively), simple in execution, and succeed in commenting on the social milieu in which they are set.
